Voyagers RTG is running low not cos of distance but cos of time. Voyager has been running for a long time, the radioactive material in the RTG is constantly decreasing through the materials halflife, think of it like a nuclear battery thats slowly running out. it doesn't collect solar energy or anything like that, its the reason RTG's where using instead of solar cells for them, cos past the orbit of mars solar panels have ot be so large to get enougth energy for basic operations that hey become hazards to the vessels manuvering.

It would add a taste of realism to the Probe, since Voyager 1 is like, very far from the sun (in interstellar space in fact) that its RTG's are barely producing enough power for the instruments.
The distance to the sun doesn't change the efficiency of the RTG. Efficiency decline with time, standard RTG can last easily 50 years.Return to KSP, reducing efficiency is impossible with "stock" module RTG.
RTG's are themocouples that use the radioactive decay from an isotope to provide the thermal part of 'therocouple'. The distance from the sun has VERY little to do with it.
